review.title: Preliminaries of a Space Situational Awareness Ontology
review.abstract: Space situational awareness (SSA) is vital for international safety and security, and the future of space travel. By improving SSA data-sharing we improve global SSA. Computational ontology should provide one means toward that goal. This paper develops the ontology of the SSA domain and takes steps in the creation of a Space Situational Awareness Ontology. It follows (Rovetto, 2015) and outlines objectives, requirements and desiderata; and describes the SSA domain and discipline of ontology. The purposes of the SSA ontology are to explore the potential for ontology development and engineering to (i) represent SSA data, general knowledge, and domain objects, (ii) clearly annotate and express the meaning of that orbital, near-earth and deep-space da-ta, and (iii) foster SSA data sharing among SSA actors and space object catalogs. By improving global SSA via actionable data- and knowledge-exchange, we can achieve the broader goals (and motivations) of (iv) advancing our capacity for planetary defense from near- or deep-space ob-ects, and (v) improving spaceflight safety for future generations.

sections.heading: Robert J. Rovetto*, T.S. Kelso†
sections.text: By improving SSA data sharing, we are improving the global SSA. Computer-assisted ontology should be a means of achieving this goal. This paper develops the ontology of the SSA domain and takes steps to create an SSA ontology. It outlines objectives, requirements and desiderates and describes the SSA domain and discipline of ontology. The purpose of SSA ontology is to explore the potential for ontology development and engineering to (i) represent SSA data, general knowledge and domain objects, (ii) clearly comment and express the importance of this orbital, near-Earth and deep data, and (iii) promote the sharing of SSA data between SSA actors and space object catalogs. By improving the global SSA through activable data and knowledge exchange, we can achieve the broader goals (and motivations), (iv) improve our capacity to defend planets and future space generations.

sections.heading: INTRODUCTION
sections.text: It is of paramount importance that early detection of potential hazards to astronauts, space capabilities and our terrestrial home is of paramount importance. Therefore, improving the state of SSA is a global necessity, one that requires international cooperation, ever-expanding sensor networks, and the analysis and dissemination of SSA data. Achieving an ideal state of SSA is to achieve a general study of reality, in real time, to develop predictive awareness of the space environment. It is the study of the types of objects and their relationships in a particular domain. Formal methods and ontological categories in this philosophical discipline are often applied to computer and information science. Products are computational artifacts that represent the individuals, species and relationships of a domain. They represent objects and ontological categories that represent objects in this philosophical discipline.

sections.heading: THE SPACE SITUATIONAL AWARENESS DOMAIN
sections.text: The universe of discourse, which needs to be expressed in an ontological framework, is the SSA domain. This paper defines situational awareness in space as situational awareness of the environments in orbit, near Earth and space. It includes the processes by which we attain this awareness, such as observation, detection, identification, tracking and prediction / propagation of space objects and orbits and trajectories of space objects; as well as the phenomena in the space environment. At another point, SSA was defined as: "the ability to observe, understand and predict the physical location of natural and artificial objects in orbit around the Earth, with the aim of avoiding collisions." [2] "Understanding and perceiving the Earth's orbiting population, the space environment and possible threats." [3] "[...] The ability to accurately characterize the space environment and activities in space." sections.heading: CONCLUSION
sections.text: This paper has presented the basics of Space Situational Awareness Ontology and outlines requirements and desiderates for formal ontologies and space taxonomies for the SSA domain; the discipline of ontology (philosophical and computational) has been described; the SSA domain to be represented ontologically has been summarized and delimited; key terms of the class have been identified; the SSAO has been introduced with part of its taxonomy and a first-order pattern formalization has been presented; the objectives of SSA ontology are: to provide formal and predictable representations of general scientific knowledge (astrodynamics, astronautics, SSA processes, etc.), of objects (spacecraft, orbital debris, sensors, etc.) and interrelations within the domain; to note instance data; and to promote space data exchange. Space object catalogs with satellite observation data can be provided with the appropriate ontology classes to enable the exchange and interoperability of space data.
